creator: shorej@sktc.net
text:
I just downloaded 1.3.26 to do a quick upgrade.  I used the same commandline
configure options I'd previously used on this machine (1.3.19).  They were
accepted without error.

./configure "--with-layout=Apache" "--show-layout" "--prefix=/usr/local"
"--sysconfdir=/etc/httpd" "--datadir=/home/httpd" "--localstatedir=/var"
"--sbindir=/usr/local/sbin" "--htdocsdir=/home/httpd/html"
"--runtimedir=/var/run" "--logfiledir=/var/log/httpd"

For some reason the configure script wouldn't generate a Makefile so I could
procede.  I haven't been able to find the error in the configure script.

From README.configure:

If you are not sure which directory layout you want, you can use the
  --show-layout option. It displays the directory layout which would be used
  but immediately exits without configuring anything.

Thanks for using Apache!
creator: nd@perlig.de
